result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis William Hueg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Travis William Hueg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Travis William Hueg was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Travis William Hueg was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED
Court dismisses Count 1.
Defendant to report to Probation August 19, 2015 by 3:00 p.m.
Defendant is eligble for expungement under 973.015.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
To be added to current payment plan with Clerk of Court.
DNA surcharge.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days and follow all recommendations of Agent.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Cooperate with any evaluation/assessment as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO CONTACT with Samantha Wise except phone or text message unless Agent approves.
-Restorative Justice Program if Victim requests.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days if requested by Agent.

Probation review hearing at 10-19-2015 04:30 pm

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Travis William Hueg appeared. Case called at 4:07 p.m. ADA Nieskes states plea agreement has been reached. Court amends Ct. 2 to disorderly conduct 947.01. Atty. Petros files plea questionnaire and treatment documents. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charges and possible penalties for count two - amended to Disorderly Conduct, def pleads Guilty, count three - def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of counts 2 and 3. Court dismisses count one. ADA Nieskes states no request for restitution was made and makes recommendation. Atty. Petros responds. 
Court Orders:
Count 1: 2 years Probation i/s - 75 Days Jail
Count 2: 2 years Probation w/h - 60 Days Jail STAYED
- Court costs
- AODA within 30 days if requested by Agent
- Psychological/psychiatric evaluation within 30 days
- Cooperate with any evaluation/assessment as directed
- DNA sample and surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to posess a firearm
- No contact with S. Wise except phone or text unless Agent approves. 
- Restorative justice, if requested
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation by 8/19/15 at 3 pm
- Follow rules and regulations of agent
- Pay supervision fees
- DEF eligible for expungement

and   _x_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant 
guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1750.00
and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, S. Wise. May have phone or text contact for purposes of arranging custody with their children. In person contact is approved for Child Exchange. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, K. Bowers.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
